summary: A lore-friendly, fully equipped player home south of Dawnstar...
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://img855.imageshack.us/img855/6320/titreen.jpg[/img][/center]

[center]A fully equipped player home. 

[b]Version 1.1[/b]

by Oaristys

[i]The mysterious beauty of Nord barrows is as attractive as the harshness of natural caves... South of Dawnstar, in the icy mountains of the north of Skyrim, adventurers will find a haven in Whispering Waters Barrow, among the waterfalls which flow on the sides of this swallow-hole converted by ancient Nords into a tomb.[/i][/center]

[center][img]http://img805.imageshack.us/img805/4537/38830642.png[/img][/center]

Thank you for reading this! This is my very first mod, so please be indulgent with me, but don\'t hesitate to criticize to help me to improve myself!

My goal was to create a simple player home in a central and convenient location, with aesthetic concerns. It\'s a house for those who want to live in a Nord tomb and who love waterfalls... The place is very natural, not over-encumbered or over-colored, to keep a realistic atmosphere. Indeed, my second goal was to respect the ambiance of Skyrim, and so I used only Nord and cave architecture (no dwemer pieces or decorations from Sovngard).

The house itself, inspired by Ustengrav, has all conveniences in one cell: weapon plaques, mannequins, enchanting and alchemy stations, forge... All the chests are marked to NOT respawn and should be safe. I also add a unique sorter script to a chest in the entrance for adventurers who just want to quickly drop their loot into the 21 chests of the house. You will find some bonuses, like books with temporary boosts of crafting and a powerful weapon the presence of which is explained by the journal of the former resident. Finally, it is very follower friendly because exterior and interior are fully navmeshed.

[center][url=http://www.confrerie-des-traducteurs.fr/skyrim/mods/bordeciel/habitations/tertre_des_eaux_murmurantes.php]Version française disponible ici[/url][/center]

[center][img]http://img138.imageshack.us/img138/7942/b2e.png[/img][/center]

[list]
[*]7 main areas:
[/list] 
- Entrance
- Throne/display area
- Bedroom
- Smithing: forge, smelter, workbench, grindstone, tanning rack, wood chopping block.
- Kitchen with a cooking pot
- Alchemy area
- Enchanting area

[list]
[*]Storage:
[/list]
- A main chest in the entrance for quick depository which sorts all you put in into the chests of your home ([b]only vanilla objects[/b]). Put the items in the chest, then activate the chain on the altar.
- 21 safe, non-respawning and labeled storage throughout the place (armors, weapons, arrows, clothes, rings, necklaces, potions, poisons, drinks, food, scrolls, soul gems, gems, ingots, ore, pelts, keys, books, gold/lockpicks, miscellaneous)
- 6 mannequins
- 6 weapon/shield plaques
- 5 weapon racks
- 3 display cases
- 2 bookshelves (2x18 books)

[list]
[*]Background:
[/list] 
- Journal of the former resident

[list]
[*]Bonuses:
[/list] 
- Three scripted books with temporary bonuses of alchemy/enchanting/smithing.
- A powerful enchanted sword hidden somewhere...

[list]
[*]Gameplay:
[/list] 
- Fully navmeshed indoors and exteriors.
- Optimized cell (room markers/portal).

[center][img]http://img27.imageshack.us/img27/4814/b3e.png[/img][/center]

See screenshot.
The barrow is located south of Dawnstar and east of the Lord Stone.

[center][img]http://img98.imageshack.us/img98/8403/b4e.png[/img][/center]

- An acquisition quest.
- An optional quest which matches the background described in the journal.
- An animal as companion.
- Optional version for the sorter to sort items from popular mods, if requested.

All suggestions are welcome!

[center][img]http://img39.imageshack.us/img39/8451/31272334.png[/img][/center]

1. Copy the .esp and .bsa files into your Skyrim/Data folder.
2. Check the .esp in the launcher or NMM.

Enjoy!

[center][img]http://img96.imageshack.us/img96/5544/b6e.png[/img][/center]

- Sorter chest doesn\'t sort player crafted potions.
- If the mannequins are moving or striking a pose, use this fix : [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=10652]Vanilla Mannequins Script Fix[/url].
- This mod will conflict with any mod using the following exterior cells : 3,12 ; 3,13 ; 4,12 ; 4,13.
- This mod conflicts with the mod \"The Arena III\".
- You can have some lag in the throne room ; I\'ll do my best to fix that in the next update.

If anyone find conflicts, please PM me and report.

[center][img]http://img714.imageshack.us/img714/1378/b10e.png[/img][/center]

1.1 : 	First release.
[Version 1.0 tested and approved by some players.]

[center][img]http://img137.imageshack.us/img137/6936/80250831.png[/img][/center]

Q: Some exterior pieces of the barrow, as stairs, are invisible...
A: It\'s a bug from the game. Save near the barrow and load: stairs should appear.

Q: There are still items in the main chest after I pull the chain...
A: Normally, all vanilla items should be sorted. If the remaining items are [b]NOT from a mod or crafted potions[/b], report it to me.

Q: How can my spouse live in the barrow?
A: Use this mod : [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11370]Spouses can live everywhere[/url].

[center][img]http://img545.imageshack.us/img545/9266/61037761.png[/img][/center]

[list]
[*]Blary for his [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=14134]open books resource[/url] .
[*]Cire992 for the idea and base of the inventory sorter script.
[*]747823 for \"[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=3871]Weapons of the Third Era[/url]\".
[*]Eldiabs for \"[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11618]Modders Resource - Weapon Racks - Bookshelves - Plaques - Mannequins[/url]\".
[*] A. and Mohawk for their help.
[*]Malhuin for beta-testing.
[*]La [url=http://www.confrerie-des-traducteurs.fr/forum/index.php]Confrérie des Traducteurs[/url] for their help and support.
[/list] 

[center][img]http://img803.imageshack.us/img803/2643/b9e.png[/img][/center]

This mod is not to be used without my permission.
For any question/request, you can find me on \"La Confrérie des Traducteurs\" or in Skyrim Nexus @ Oaristys.

[line]

Don\'t forget to endorse if you enjoy!
Please comment and let me know what you think, all feedback and suggestions are greatly appreciated!
author: Oaristys
